{"step_by_step_thinking": "Smoking cessation can indeed lead to an increase in birth weight, as smoking during pregnancy is associated with low birth weight. Aspirin is not typically associated with increasing birth weight. Calcium and vitamin D supplements can contribute to the healthy development of the baby, but they are not directly linked to an increase in birth weight. Bed rest is not directly associated with an increase in birth weight.", "answer_choice": "A"}
